revised_title: Effects of Suction on Nonlinear Stability of 3D Boundary Layer Above a Rotating Disc
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of suction on the nonlinear stability of the three-dimensional boundary layer above a rotating disc. They find that suction stabilizes the flow, while blowing destabilizes it. This study helps in understanding the role of suction in practical flows and its potential to delay the onset of transition.
